nodes.bodyText: Same comment as in the other PR, might be worth checking if the plain english description is standard imagery basemap, as opposed to the technical enum name?
I'm just thinking on most of them I think it just says "with a basemap style". Maybe that is easier. Any thoughts @Rachael-E ?

Just noticing most of the other comments for this line in other samples now say create a map with..
Might be nice to make it uniform?
So as you have in the next file:

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  // create an ArcGISMap with the topographic basemap
          
          
            
                  // create a map with the topographic basemap style
Thanks yes that was the plan to make it consistent, so will tidy this one!

This should either say ArcGISMap or 'map' without backticks. Easy to forget that Map == Key-value-Pair!

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            1. Create a `Map`, specifying a basemap style.
          
          
            
            1. Create a `ArcGISMap`, specifying a basemap style.
          
      
    
    
  

Might be a good thing to create an issue to search for Map in backticks in all readme files and get rid of those relics once and for all ;)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -14,18 +14,20 @@ When the map loads, note the specific location and scale of the initial map view
 
 ## How it works
 
-1. Create a `Map`, specifying a basemap type, latitude and longitude in WGS84, and a level of detail.
+1. Create a `Map`, specifying a basemap style.

nodes.bodyText: Ah cool, I will make a note 👍

nodes.bodyText: for LOD 11, we could go for 288895, rounded down to 288800 should be ok if you want it to look a little neater!
